author: n3tsurge
description: This capability involves establishing the ability to collect data that has been transferred across networks or systems. This includes implementing mechanisms to capture and store data transfers, ensuring that all transferred data can be retrieved and analyzed when necessary. It is essential for maintaining data integrity, compliance with regulations, and enhancing overall security posture by providing visibility into data movement within the organization.

requirements.description: Staff must be trained and qualified to perform this capability effectively.
Documented procedures and playbooks must be available for executing this capability.
Network monitoring tools and access to network infrastructure for analysis and control.

title: Establish Ability to Collect Data Transferred

references.name: NIST SP 800-137: Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM)
MITRE ATT&CK: Discovery Tactics and Detection Strategies
CISA Zero Trust Architecture - Monitoring and Analytics
